author: sageadmin

fields.name: Description
fields.content: When executing a task, it will complete and show several notifications. The emails appear in the Manage Unsent Emails list either with a future send time or the time the system runs the task. The emails will quickly drop off the list or don't appear after completing the task.

fields.name: Resolution
fields.content:
▼ Verify the email addresses

MyAssistant can't use a Microsoft Exchange Server Group to set up a task as it requires a valid email address. For a task to use an Outlook distribution list, you must install and set up Microsoft Outlook on the server.

  1. Open the Task.
  2. Go to the Email screen.
  3. Verify the email address and directories.
    • Verify that To, CC, BCC, or an email directory includes the intended email addresses
    • Replace the Microsoft Exchange Server Group with an email address or directory
    • For a custom email distribution list, install and configure Microsoft Outlook on the server

▼ Configure task to Notify for each run

If a task is set up to Notify Once under the Notification option, re-running the task will only send emails if the task finds new conditions.

  1. Open the task.
  2. Go to Notification Options.
  3. Select Notify each time the task is run.
  4. [[Delete the existing notifications|230831230600187]].
  5. Run the task.

▼ Verify SQL services status and restart

MyAssistant requires the SQL Server (ISD) and SQL Server Browser services enabled and running.

  1. Log on to the server as an administrator.
  2. Go to Windows Services.
  3. Ensure the SQL Server Browser service is enabled and running.
  4. Restart the service even if it's running.
  5. Ensure the SQL Server (ISD) service is enabled and running.
  6. Restart the service even if it's running.  NOTE: This service name can vary if you set up your own SQL instance during the MyAssistant install. 

▼ Mail settings in MyAssistant Configuration Manager

For all versions

  1. Log on to the server as the administrator who performed the initial activation of MyAssistant on the server.
  2. Start MyAssistant Configuration Manager.
  3. Click the Notification E-Mail Account tab.
  4. Click the Test mail settings... button.
     NOTE: If you receive an error, ensure your Outgoing Mail Server, Username, Password, Port, and encrypted SSL settings are correct. [[Check your mail server settings.|222924550020828]] 

For only versions 20.3.5 and later

  1. Launch MyAssistant Designer.
  2. Go to File, Options.
  3. Go to Server Settings.
  4. Click the Test button on the correct email account line.
     NOTE: If you receive an error, ensure your Outgoing Mail Server, Username, Password, Port, and encrypted SSL settings are correct. [[Check your mail server settings.|222924550020828]]

▼ Antivirus or firewall blocks the connection

  1. Disable the antivirus and firewall on the server temporarily.
  2. Do a test run for the task to determine if emails go through.
  3. If the test is successful, work with your IT team to configure [[the antivirus and firewall exceptions|222924750023771]].

▼ Attachment too large

This requires research and troubleshooting.

  • Why is the attachment too large?
  • Are the report parameters incorrect?
  • Does data need archiving in Sage 300 CRE?
  • Does the task condition need modification?

▼ Report has no data

Check out the article when the [[MyAssistant task runs, but there are no email notifications because the report wasn't produced.|220924560106094]]

▼ Related resources and troubleshooting

Troubleshooting connection to the mail server

  1. Open a CMD prompt.
  2. Telnet MailServerName 25.
     NOTE: Replace the MailServerName with your actual server name. Sometimes it uses mail.YourDomainName.com format 
  3. Press Enter.
  4. This will either return a sequence of information related to your mail server or a connection error.

Gmail support document

  • Send email from a printer, scanner, or app
  • SMTP Error Reference

Microsoft Exchange support document

  • How to set up a multifunction device or application to send email using Microsoft 365 or Office 365
  • Find my NDR code and get help delivering my email

title: Tasks run normally but users don't receive email notifications
summary: Tasks run successfully in Sage MyAssistant, but you don't receive email notifications. There can be several causes for this behavior.
